IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The school is a private institution established in 1968, which provides a comprehensive educational program for grades pre-kindergarten through twelve. The School primarily serves students in Cabarrus County, North Carolina and surrounding areas. The Cannon School community instills academic excellence and personal resonsibilty, inspires athletic and artisitic accomplishment, and promotes respect for diversity within a challenging and safe educational environment.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Provision of a quality K-12 educational program within a safe, diverse, and challenging environment.
IRS990.Description: primary and secondary education which benefits students without regard to race, religion or national origin.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Endowment funds are used to fund a variety of programs that are aligned with the school's exempt purpose. Those funds with donor imposed restrictions are expended according to the donor restrictions. There are spending policies based upon investment returns.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ASC 740 (formerly Financial Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") Interpretation No. 48, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes-an Interpretation of FASB Statement No. 109), was adopted as of July 1, 2008. This interpretation was enacted to clarify uncertainty in income taxes recognized in the financial statements in accordance with ASC 740. Under ASC 740, an entity must recognize a tax benefit or expense from an uncertain tax position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by the taxing authorities, based on the technical merits of the position. The School has no uncertain tax positions as of June 30, 2010.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The policy is written in our applications only, but is not actively publicized via media outlets.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Financial aid awards are administered by the school and are used to offset charges to student accounts. No exchange of real funds ever takes place. The award is simply a credit towards the tuition balance.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The school provides the Head of School with grossed-up payments to reimburse the Head for tuition payments related to his children's attendance at Cannon. The School also provides the Head with a discretionary spending account that can be used for travel and other activities related to School business. Finally, the school also reimburses the Head for membership dues to his country club.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: North Carolina Capital Facilities Finance Agency

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The School's Controller, Director of Finance, and Board Treasurer will review the draft 990 before it is submitted for final filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Trustees are required to review and sign this document annually. Currently, officers and key employees are not required to sign this document, but the school is studying the benefits of extending this policy to its officers & key employees. The Head of School's assistant collects all signed conflict of interest policies from trustees and reviews for any potential issues. These are collected from all new trustees as they change during the year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The School has a Compensation Committee for its Head of School that undertook initial studies of comparability data to determine the Head's overall compensation. Additionally, the compensation is re-examined on a periodic basis to make the same determination. The school has a full-time HR Director that assists in pulling together compensation market data for any given position that the School is attempting to fill. This information is used as a guideline for arriving at the specific compensation level of the individual filling the position.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest polciy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
The Finance Committee oversees the selection of the audit firm and approval of the audited statements.
